responses.rationale: The segment uses positive framing ('short-term blip', 'resolve itself very quickly') which is not a bare negation.
The segment describes successful containment ('quickly reined in and stamped out') which is not a bare negation.
The segment uses negative framing ('collateral damage') which is not a bare negation.
The segment describes increasing risk ('greater the risk') which is not a bare negation.
The segment describes actions being taken and mentions 'increased risk', neither of which is a bare negation.
The segment uses negative framing ('bad guy viruses') which is not a bare negation.
The segment uses positive framing ('short-term blip', 'resolve itself very quickly', 'new pullets coming') which is not a bare negation.
The segment describes a group at 'higher risk' which is not a bare negation.
The segment describes a group at 'increased risk' and advises precautions, neither of which is a bare negation.
The segment describes expected price 'surge' and 'historically low levels', neither of which is a bare negation.
The segment contains 'risk... remains low' and 'preparing', which are explicit calming cues (Q5 Low-Risk/Preparedness), so it is not a bare negation without calming.
The segment uses vivid descriptions of symptoms which is not a bare negation.
